page.title: 02St.Nicholas Church Beverley
page.content: The vicar of St.Nicholas Church is called Rev. Russell Dixon. St. Nicholas parish is the oldest parish in Beverley, and it serves the area east of the railway lines. Originally the building was nearer to the Beck, but it fell down in the reign of Queen Anne. In the olden days this part of Beverley was very busy,it was a flourishing port. Trade with the Netherlands thrived and evidence survives today in the form of streetnames. Wealth created by shipping made it possible for the merchants to move to the north of Beverley and provide the funds to build the beautiful church of St.Marys.
